alert.note: Alert for Burke (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 8:39AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia, including the following county, Burke. Portions of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Aiken and Barnwell. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 839 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plant Vogtle, Jackson, Girard, Shell Bluff Landing and Savannah River Site H Canyon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
